definition:
The *standard enumeration* of $\lbrace 0,1\rbrace ^{*}$ is the sequence
of strings $s_0 =\lambda$, $s_1 = 0$, $s_2 = 1$, $s_3 = 00$, $s_4 = 01$,
$\cdots$ in lexicographic order.

The *characteristic function* of a language $A$ is
$\chi_{A}:\mathbb{N}\rightarrow \lbrace 0, 1\rbrace$ such that
$$\chi_{A}(n)=\begin{cases}
1,\text{ if }s_n \in A\\
0,\text{ if }s_n \notin A.
\end{cases}$$ The *characteristic sequence* of a language $A$ (also
denoted as $\chi_A$) is the concatenation of the values of the
characteristic function in the natural order.
